aight,
since i haven't had a moment over the past few months i hadn't been keeping 
up with this charecter descussion, so with the possibility of looking like 
an idiot, i'm going to say a few broad things about ballance.

the different charectors in gladiator that we have at the moment have 4 
basic levels of power. the insane: the mage, archmage and cleric, and the 
powerful: archer, soldier and thief, are what people hire individually. we 
then have the mediocre: elf, druid, and maybe orc or barbarian, and 
everything else are the week.

personally i think this ordering is imperfect. if i were to see gladiator 
changed here would be 3 levels. here they are:

primary charecters: having the power of a soldier or archer now, this group 
should include the big three (weakened), archer, soldier, thief (maybe 
slightly weekened), druid (strengthened), again maybe orc or barbarian 
(strengthened), and some new charecters.

Secondary charecters: not nessessarily permenent members of a team; only 
usefull in certain situations, this group could include: Elf (changed so as 
to be more interesting), the undead and fire elementals (hired, not 
summened), orc, orc captain or barbarian if their not primary, and you're 
alcamist and dwarf. I also thaught the cleric could be devided into 
necromancer and healer, which would both go here.

Monsters: the horde. everything else including slimes, all sommoned versons 
of creatures ect. alot of new charectors could go here. these creatures 
could either be un hireable or hireable but untrainable.

a few more points are that inproving any summonable charecter class inproves 
their summoner exponentially, so all summoned charecters we want to inprove 
should have 2 versons, the summoned kind and the hired kind. also if we make 
too meny new types of charecters we could give new charecter types as prizes 
after certain levels, if thats programable. finally we need to remember that 
someone needs to draw something like 16 pictures for each now class (not 2 
like the giant skeleton).

thank you all for hearing me out. i'm probably making no sense. are we even 
contemplating new charecter classes to make changes to the game or cuz we 
feal like it, like we did 2 years ago. i'm probably gunna drop out of the 
group again after i send this letter because i have my GCSEs soon (any brits 
on this list?). if a patch of gladiator is coming out i look forward to it. 
if not i need to look farther forward.

i'll respond to anything this week. then i'll be gone for a week

bi

ps. a don't thing the orc captian should be given swimming and net throwing 
because these are both aquatic abilities and there is nothing watery about 
the orc captian. the orc captain should be what the golum wished it were: an 
ubserdly powerful base attacker with only a few do even MORE dammage-ish 
abilities




From: "ineedhelpnow2" <ineedhelpnow2@...>
Reply-To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [gladiator] Re: CE: Orc Captains and Thieves
Date: Mon, 31 Mar 2003 02:26:34 -0000

--- In gladiator@yahoogroups.com, "Daniel Paul Hightower"
<dph_of_rules@u...> wrote:
 > This week we are talking about orc captains and thieves.
 >
 > (If I have overlooked any existing character class, let me know
before
 > next week)

Orc Captians - as of now they are a joke, you might as well be a
soldier and get the magical abilities.

Hmm... I cant really think of GOOD abilities for the Orc Captian
w/out copying other classes. BUT one really cool "ability" that orc
captians could have (this probably would be hard to code) could be
Rally Troops, where allied troops in the surrounding area would get a
boost to health, speed, and magic for a short duration (for every
time cast.)


Thieves- This class is really quite ausome and devisating once you
get high leveled bombs.

With the addition of doors in many levels I think the theives should
have the ability to Pick Locks and pass through doors without having
to find the keys.
